text: You can get the history for certain properties, so if you want to see how many times the owner/team has. changed for that ticket just use the propertiesWithHistory parameter
so you're endpoint url would look like this:`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/tickets?propertiesWithHistory=HubSpot_owner_id>

Do any of you know the limitations of (Public) Beta access on sandbox portals?
I have an enterprise portal, which has the option to join the “Form + preview editor for HubDB rows”, and also has has the built-in “Order” functionality on rows enabled.
However, in our sandbox portal neither of these are available, making it quite difficult to actually test and utilise the new features.
Even for those sandbox portals, I think you need to request to join beta to get those features. <@UN0NUBU3S> Is that correct?
Huh, that “old way” of signing up with an email and portal number, role, company and such?
Can u give your sandvox portal id and we can try ot add it to beta
Is there a way with CRM Cards to have any API creation / patching being done to _ignore_ team usage rights?
I noticed that somehow, the API calls within the CRM Card are going based on the access rights for the person viewing the content.
I think this solves my problem
